column4: you might find entering commands in anyway -- usually it's the case that it's faster to copy and paste into a terminal than figure out how the clicky things work
you wouldn't have a problem. there isn't really anything that you need to know commands for any more (although there is a lot of neat things you can't do with a gui)

the primary reason that is done is that people have different desktops (e.g. gnome vs kde) or might have to work from a command line for some reason. there are different graphical tools to get a job done, but you can always count on the command line tools to be the same
it is easier to say "apt-get install thunderbird" than explain what the different desktops are and how to navigate the menus
